title: Learning to Fly
text:
Preface
This document is a tool to help me write down some key concepts that I come across as I’m learning to analyze data in text format. I want to document my learning experience and take some notes that I can re-visit if needed.

title: 1  Introduction
section: 1.1 Some basic concepts related to handling text
text:
1.1 Some basic concepts related to handling text

String: a data type consisting of a sequence of characters
Token: a meaningful unit of text such as a word, sentence, lines of text, paragraphs etc.
Corpus: In linguistics, a corpus (plural corpora) or text corpus is a language resource consisting of a large and structured set of texts (nowadays usually electronically stored and processed). In NLP context, corpus usually stores the text along with metadata.
Document-term matrix: a matrix where each row presents one document (such as a book or article), each column represents one term, and each value states the number of appearances in of that term in the document (Silge and Robinson 2017)





Hvitfeldt, E., and J. Silge. 2022. Supervised Machine Learning for Text Analysis in R. CRC Press. https://smltar.com/.


Silge, J., and D. Robinson. 2017. Text Mining with R: A Tidy Approach. O’Reilly Media. https://www.tidytextmining.com/.

title: 2  Extracting and Analyzing Words
text:
2.1 Words as Tokens
In order to analyze natural language, the raw text needs to be somehow transformed into a numeric format.

title: 2  Extracting and Analyzing Words
text:
2.2 TF-IDF
Term frequency (TF), inverse document frequency (IDF), and their product (TF-IDF) which describes the frequency of the term adjusted for how rarely it is used (Silge and Robinson 2017), are all quantities which can be used for assessing the importance of a word in a passage of text.

The statistic tf-idf is intended to measure how important a word is to a document in a collection (or corpus) of documents, for example, to one novel in a collection of novels or to one website in a collection of websites.





Silge, J., and D. Robinson. 2017. Text Mining with R: A Tidy Approach. O’Reilly Media. https://www.tidytextmining.com/.
